title: WATCH: John Calipari goes on curse-laden rant in defending Mark Fox, Mark Gottfried
text:
1h ago • 2 min read 
Kentucky’s close road victory over Georgia might have some Bulldogs fans thinking it’s time to move on from coach Mark Fox. 
John Calipari doesn’t want to hear any of that. 
In his postgame press conference Saturday, Calipari went on a two-minute rant about the state of the coaching profession in 2017. He made a point of sticking up for Fox and another coach who’s not even in his league: the recently fired Mark Gottfried, who’s done at NC State once the Wolfpack’s season ends. 
“Here’s what bothers me about this profession right now,” Calipari starts in the video below, then proceeds to recap Georgia’s rugged run through the SEC. 
“But he keeps his team together,” Calipari says of Fox. “That’s coaching. Not when things are going good. It’s when things go south and you lose a bunch in a row, how do you get them and go. ... Well we all want to win more. No kidding. Live [in my shoes]. You wanna win more? We gotta win by 25 or we got problems. We win by two or in overtime, people are jumping off bridges.” 
Calipari is not wrong with his hyperbole there. When the Wildcats are not romping the weak SEC, UK fans and college basketball writers frequently question the state of the program and why it’s not operating at the highest levels. 
But from there, Calipari veers into Gottfried’s situation, and that’s when he drops an S-bomb.
